entries.text: Hey there, this is a template for making interactive CYOA's. It's still very much a work in progress, but I hope you find some use for it. A more detailed version of the info below will be covered in the README.md file. But keep scrolling if you want a quick overview of what can be currrently done
Okay, here's kinda the gist of how things work:

entries.title: Files
entries.text:
- Dependencies aside, there are 4 files of note within the repo
- data.json is the lifeblood of the system and supplies all the text, point values, and other rules the system will follow
- main.css is your style file, you will alter this to change the look of your CYOA.
- index.html and macros.js by default should not be tampered with unless you know what you're doing.

entries.title: Notes
entries.text: - By default, the system will refuse to let you go below 0 points. Options will disable if you try. This can be turned off </br> - Clicking a selectible option selects it, Click again to deselect </br> - Clicking "Show Selected" will bring up a list of selected options </br> - Show selected will order and sort things by group. Individual objects within a group are not sorted </br> - This is very much a work in progress

entries.title: Choice Limited Options
entries.text: These choices have a limit of 1, you may only pick one. This limit applies only to this group of options and has no effect on the rest of the CYOA. To make a set of options limited, set limit=<number> . Ensure a point value of 0 or the intended amount is set to ensure the option is selectable

entries.title: Pick Me
entries.text: Only Pick me

entries.title: One and Only
entries.text: I can only be picked

entries.title: Not Them
entries.text: This one Only

entries.title: Point Limited Options
entries.text: These options are free to be picked, but have a point cost. These points can be renamed to whatever

entries.title: 5 Pointer
entries.text: This one costs 5 points. This plus the next one will take up all your points

entries.title: Another 5
entries.text: This one costs 5 points. This plus the last one will take up all your points

entries.title: Too Expensive
entries.text: This one is too expensive to purchase.

entries.title: Get Points
entries.text: This one costs -5 Points. This will give you points

entries.title: No Price
entries.text: This one is free. By default, items without a price will not have a price listed

entries.title: Labeled Price
entries.text: This one is also free, but has a replacement text for the price. This is useful if you want to have conditionals

entries.title: Require/Conflict
entries.text: The third way of restricting choices is by either requiring or prohibiting another option to be picked. These require an ID to be set

entries.title: Path A
entries.text: I'm the start of a path of choices to my right. You must select me before selecting Path A2

entries.title: Path A2
entries.text: I require Path A to be Selected, I unlock Path A3

entries.title: Path A3
entries.text: I am the ultimate choice of Path A, I require A2 and A to be picked first

entries.title: Path B
entries.text: I'm an alternate Path, selecting me locks you out of Path A

entries.title: Path B2
entries.text: I require Path B to be Selected, I unlock Path B3

entries.title: Path B3
entries.text: I am the ultimate choice of Path B, I require B2 and B to be picked first

entries.title: Seperator
entries.text: This doesn't serve much point for interactive CYOA's. But if you want to give yourself a clean point to cut for images, it's there.
